1. This Order may be cited as the Roads Act 1993 (Classification of 

National Roads) (Amendment) Order 2023.

title: on me by sections 8, 10(1)(a) and (3)(a) of the Roads Act 1993 (No. 14 of 1993)
heading: In this Order, “Order of 2012” means the Roads Act 1993 (Classification
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order, “Order of 2012” means the Roads Act 1993 (Classification 

of National Roads) Order 2012 (S.I. No. 53 of 2012).
text_norm: 2 order order 2012 mean road act 1993 (classification national roads) order 2012 (s.i no 53 2012)

title: on me by sections 8, 10(1)(a) and (3)(a) of the Roads Act 1993 (No. 14 of 1993)
heading: 3. The Order of 2012 is amended in Schedule 1 by the substitution of the
text_raw:
3. The Order of 2012 is amended in Schedule 1 by the substitution of the 
following for the matter in column (2) opposite the mention of the national 
primary road N5 in column (1): 

“Longford - Westport, County Mayo 

Between its junction with N4 at Aghadegnan in the county of 
Longford and its junction with N59 at Deerpark East at Westport in 
the county of Mayo via Aghareagh and Kilmore Cross in the county 
of Longford: Termonbarry Bridge at the boundary between the 
county of Longford and the county of Roscommon: Graffoge, 
Scramoge, Farnbeg; Bridge Street and Church Street at Strokestown; 
Tulsk Cross, Tulsk, Toberrory, Gortnagoyne, Bellanagare, 
Frenchpark, Teevnacreeva, Toobrackan, and Currinah in the county 
of Roscommon: Fauleens, Cloonmeen West, Ballyglass East (and 
including link roads to N17), Mullenmadoge, Cloonlara, Kilbride, 
Carrowcanada, Lislackagh, Ballymiles, Barleyhill, Bohola, 
Bellavary, Capparanny, Clogher, Liscromwell, Doogary, 
Aghadrinigh, Derrylea, Drumneen, Sheean and Monamore (and 
including link to R309) in the county of Mayo.”.
text_norm: 3 order 2012 amended schedule 1 substitution following matter column (2) opposite mention national primary road n5 column (1) longford - westport county mayo junction n4 aghadegnan county longford junction n59 deerpark east westport county mayo via aghareagh kilmore cross county longford termonbarry bridge boundary county longford county roscommon graffoge scramoge farnbeg bridge street church street strokestown tulsk cross tulsk toberrory gortnagoyne bellanagare frenchpark teevnacreeva toobrackan currinah county roscommon fauleens cloonmeen west ballyglass east (and including link road n17) mullenmadoge cloonlara kilbride carrowcanada lislackagh ballymiles barleyhill bohola bellavary capparanny clogher liscromwell doogary aghadrinigh derrylea drumneen sheean monamore (and including link r309) county mayo

title: on me by sections 8, 10(1)(a) and (3)(a) of the Roads Act 1993 (No. 14 of 1993)
heading: 4. The Order of 2012 is amended in Schedule 2 –
text_raw:
4. The Order of 2012 is amended in Schedule 2 – 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following for the matter in column (2) 
opposite the mention of the national secondary road N59 in 
column (1): 

“Belladrehid, County Sligo - Westport, County Mayo - Galway 
City 

Between its junction with N4 at Belladrehid in the county of Sligo 
and its junction with N6 at Quincentenary Bridge Approach Road in 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 5th September, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [436] 3 

the city of Galway via Ballysadare, Dromore West, Culleens and 
Carrownurlar in the county of Sligo: Dooyeaghny and Quignalegan; 
Bunree Bridge, Sligo Road, Cathedral Road, Ham Bridge, Emmet 
Street, (and via Lower Bridge), Dillon Terrace, Humbert Street, 
Circular Road, Pound Street, Teeling Street and Lord Edward Street 
at Ballina; Coolcran, Ballymanagh; Ballina Street, Main Street and 
Erris Street at Crossmolina; Eskeragh Bridge, Moneynierin, 
Bellacorick, Bangor, Croaghaun, Ballycroy, Ballyveeny, 
Mallaranny, Rosturk; Georges Street, Main Street and Medlicott 
Street at Newport; Knockychottaun, Deerpark East; Newport Road, 
Newport Street, North Mall, Bridge Street, Shop Street (and via 
James Street), Lower Peter Street, Quay Street, Quay Road and 
Leenane Road at Westport; Liscarney, Erriff Bridge and Aasleagh in 
the county of Mayo: Leenaun, Kylemore, Letterfrack, Moyard, 
Streamstown, Clifden, Derrylea, Ballinafad, An Gharmain, Lios 
Uachtair, Seanadh Chaola, Maam Cross, Bunnakill; Main Street at 
Oughterard; Maigh Cuilinn and Kentfield in the county of Galway: 
Upper Newcastle (and via Thomas Hynes Road) in the city of 
Galway.”, 

(b) by the substitution of the following for the matter in column (2) 
opposite the mention of the national secondary road N60 in 
column (1): 

“Roscommon - Castlebar, County Mayo 

Between its junction with N61 at Cloonbrackna in the county of 
Roscommon and its junction with N5 at Doogary at Castlebar in the 
county of Mayo via Racecourse Road, Lissagallan and Drumatemple 
in the county of Roscommon: Ballymoe Bridge at the boundary 
between the county of Roscommon and the county of Galway: 
Ballymoe in the county of Galway: Harristown; Saint Patrick Street 
and Main Street at Castlerea; Fortaugustus, Ballinlough and Scregg 
in the county of Roscommon: Coolnafarna, Devlis; Abbey Street, 
Bridge Street and Clare Street at Ballyhaunis; Hazelhill, Brickeens, 
Cuilmore and Clare; Inner Relief Road and Convent Road at 
Claremorris; Lugatemple, Brees, Balla, Moat, Manulla Bridge and 
Breaghwy in the county of Mayo.”, 

and 

(c) 

by the substitution of the following for the matter in column (2) 
opposite the mention of the national secondary road N84 in 
column (1): 

“Galway - Castlebar, County Mayo 

Between its junction with N6 at Bothar na dTreabh in the city of 
Galway and its junction with N5 at Aghadrinagh at Castlebar in the 
county of Mayo via Headford Road in the city of Galway: Ceathrú 
an Bhrúnaigh and Castlecreevey; High Street, Main Street and 
Bridge Street at Headford; Racepark and Doonlaur in the county of 
Galway: Shrule Bridge at the boundary between the county of 
Galway and the county of Mayo: Shrule, Kilmaine, Ballytrasna; The 

 
 4 [436] 

Common, Bowgate Street, Main Street (and via Glebe Street and 
New Street), Bridge Street, High Street and Chapel Road at 
Ballinrobe; Partrai and Ballyhean in the county of Mayo.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 August, 2023. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, Climate, Communications 
and Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [436] 5

title: on me by sections 8, 10(1)(a) and (3)(a) of the Roads Act 1993 (No. 14 of 1993)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order amends the Schedule of the Roads Act 1993 (Classification of 
National Roads) Order 2012 (S.I. No. 53 of 2012) to address road classification 
issues regarding the N5 in County Mayo. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [436]
